page.title: 01 LODDINGTON AND DISTRICT
page.content: The Block which we looked at for the Domesday Project is very typical of central Northamptonshire. The Countryside is open, undulating land given over almost completely to arable farming. There are parts which were extensively quarried for ironstone but these are now all restored and farmed. Within the block are three villages. Loddington is the largest and is a loose-knit village built around a roughly circular network of village roads with the church at the centre. Cransley and Thorpe Malsor are linear villages. All three villages are dominated by spired churches.
